roleset.name: has responsibility for, handles, insures, accounts for
roleset.note: COVER-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. No Vncls, because of physicality constraints on fill-9.8 and contiguous_location-47.8, but this can be construed as a metaphorical extension of those classes. (from cover.01-v)
COVERAGE-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. No VNcls. (from coverage.01-n)
COVERING-N NOTES: Corresponds with cover.01 (from covering.01-n)

roles.note: Differs from PB cover.01 in the inclusion of arg3, danger. This was added based on autogen examples. (from coverage.01-n)

example.name: agentive subject
example.text: Market-makers-1 are shopping *trace*-1 to cover book requirements in FTSE 100 shares.

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: The training wage covers only workers who are 16 to 19 years old.
example.arg: workers who are 16 to 19 years old

example.name: passive
example.text: At least costs-1 should be covered *trace*-1.

example.name: autogen1
example.text: government coverage of all interest costs while the student is inschool
example.arg: of all interest costs while the student is in school

example.name: autogen2
example.text: cash coverage of interest

example.name: args 1 and 3
example.text: maximum fire coverage of the entire county

example.name: args 0, 1 and 3
example.text: the insurance company's coverage of the facility againt fire

example.name: with PRP and EXT
example.text: complete coverage of the facility for offline measurement.

example.name: with args 2 and 3
example.text: Travel delay coverage of $100

example.name: with Arg0
example.text: Poppy's covering of Tina's shift was very much appreciated.

roleset.name: smear, put over, spreading across
roleset.note: COVER-V NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of VNcls fill-9.8 and contiguous_location-47.8. (from cover.02-v)
COVERING-N NOTES: Corresponds with cover.02. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from covering.02-n)

roles.note: Please note the similarity between the two rolesets. Arg2 may occur as subject in either sense, but potentially more often in cover.01. Use coverage.06 for physical covering.

example.name: lunchtime
example.text: John covered the bread with peanut butter.

example.name: Arg2 as active subject
example.text: The substance covered the ground completely .
Wanda's covering of her peanut butter sandwich with horseradish made her realize she needed glasses.

roleset.name: broadcast
roleset.note: COVER-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cover' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus. (from cover.03-v predicate notes)
COVERAGE-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. no Vncls. (from coverage.03-n)

example.name: broadcast news
example.text: Give television-1 a chance *trace*-1 to cover live any breaking of the law...

example.name: autogen1
example.text: its coverage of the company

example.name: autogen2
example.text: news coverage

example.name: arg0
example.text: the coverage from the news uh section

example.name: argMs
example.text: almost non-stop on the scene coverage

example.name: TV as agent
example.text: Television coverage of the war

example.name: live coverage
example.text: live coverage of tomorrow 's memorial service for the sailors who died on the `` USS Cole , ''
example.arg: of tomorrow's memorial service for the sailors who died on the " USS Cole , "

example.name: CYA
example.text: [Its officials and utility subsidiaries]-1 tried *trace-1* to cover up their accounting for spare parts *trace-2* to evade federal income taxes.

roleset.name: cover completely
roleset.note: COVER_OVER-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on Brown corpus. Comparison to close_over. No Vncls. (from cover.05-v)

roles.note: Note that in this usage, 'over' is not construed as the head of a PP because what would then be the PP would not end up being the location of the covering, but rather the thing covered. (from cover.05-v)

example.name: all args
example.text: They -1 wet the lightweight cloth in a basin and *trace*-1 covered it over with clay that Argiento brought from the bank of the Tiber
example.arg: with clay that Argiento brought from the bank of the Tiber.

roleset.name: physical coverage
roleset.note: COVERAGE-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of VNcls fill-9.8 and contiguous_location-47.8, although Vncls 9.8 might not actually apply in this case, just 47.8.. Comparison to verb-insure.02. (from coverage.02-n)

example.name: arg2
example.text: Nanning City 's forest area has reached 344,000 , with forest coverage reaching 36.3 %

example.name: EXT and arg2
example.text: By the year 2000 , it will strive to reach 37 % greenification coverage , 32 % of green land and 10 square meters per capita public green land area in the whole city .

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: Given an average sweat coverage of the container surface, the water content of the cargo ought to have fallen by approximately 0.64%.

example.name: arg2 genetive
example.text: its coverage of the surface of the sidewall
example.arg: of the surface of the sidewall
